meanings.sent1: My best friend is the trustworthier person I know.
meanings.sent2: The new employee proved to be trustworthier than the previous one.
meanings.sent3: It's easier to sleep at night knowing your secrets are safe with a trustworthier friend.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree seemed trustworthier than the fragile sapling next to it.
meanings.sent5: A loyal dog is the trustworthier companion one could ask for.

meanings.definition: More deserving of trust than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the candidates, she appeared to be the trustworthier choice.
meanings.sent2: The antique store seemed trustworthier than the online seller.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at me with a trustworthier expression than usual.
meanings.sent4: The old library felt trustworthier than any digital archive.
meanings.sent5: The handwritten letter felt trustworthier than a printed email.
